question: Question_12_(c)
statement:
Mark each statement either True or False. You do not have to justify
your answer.

If the matrix A has 6 rows and 9 columns, then dim(N(A)) $\geq$ 3.
sols:
\textbf{True}. By the rank nullity theorem $dim(N(A)) = n - rank(A)$
$n = 9$ (columns)The rank is the number of linearly independent columns of A, in this
case is at the most 6, likewise dim(N(A)) $\geq$ 3.
